questions.Name: Which activity contributes to the 'where are we now?' step of the 'continual improvement' model?
questions.explaination: Correct: Performing baseline assessments

questions.Name: Which step of the continual improvement model includes baseline assessments?
questions.explaination: Correct: Where are we now?

Options.Name: Where do we want to be?

questions.Name: Which describes a 'change authority'?
questions.explaination: Correct: A person who approves a change

Options.Name: A model used to determine who will assess a change
A person who approves a change
A tool used to help plan changes
A way to manage the people aspects of change

questions.Name: Which is NOT a component of the service value system?
questions.explaination: Correct: Opportunity and demand

questions.Name: Which dimension considers data security and privacy?
questions.explaination: Correct: Information and technology

questions.Name: Which statement about outputs is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: They contribute to the achievement of outcomes

Options.Name: They capture customer demand for services
They contribute to the achievement of outcomes
They describe how the service performs

questions.Name: Which practice has a strong influence on the user experience and perception of the service provider?
questions.explaination: Correct: Service desk

questions.Name: Which statement about service relationship management is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: It requires co-operation of both the service provider and service consumer

Options.Name: It focuses on the service actions performed by users
It requires the service consumer to create resources for the service provider
It requires co-operation of both the service provider and service consumer
It focuses on the fulfilment of the agreed service actions

questions.Name: What is the MOST important reason for prioritizing incidents?
questions.explaination: Correct: To ensure that incidents with highest impact are resolved first

Options.Name: To ensure that user expectations are realistic
To ensure that incidents with highest impact are resolved first
To provide links to related changes and known errors

questions.Name: Which 'service level management' activity helps staff to deliver a more business-focused service?
questions.explaination: Correct: Understanding the ongoing requirements of customers

Options.Name: Creating targets based on the percentage of uptime of a service
Understanding the ongoing requirements of customers
Using complex technical terminology in service level agreements (SLAs)

questions.Name: Which practice has a purpose that includes the handling of pre-defined, user-initiated demands for service?
questions.explaination: Correct: Service request management

questions.Name: What is defined as an unplanned interruption or reduction in the quality of a service?
questions.explaination: Correct: An incident

questions.Name: Which guiding principle considers which parts of an existing process should be kept by identifying how they contribute to value creation?
questions.explaination: Correct: Keep it simple and practical

questions.Name: What is the purpose of the 'monitoring and event management' practice?
questions.explaination: Correct: To systematically observe services and service components

Options.Name: To restore normal service operation as quickly as possible
To manage workarounds and known errors
To capture demand for incident resolution and service requests
To systematically observe services and service components

questions.Name: Which statement about outcomes is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: Outcomes rely on outputs to deliver results for a stakeholder

Options.Name: Outcomes rely on outputs to deliver results for a stakeholder
Outcomes use activities to produce tangible or intangible deliverables
Outcomes give service consumers assurance of products or services
Outcomes help a service consumer to assess the cost of a specific activity

questions.Name: Which skill is required by the 'service level management' practice?
questions.explaination: Correct: Supplier management

questions.Name: Which statement about the 'continual improvement model' is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: The flow of the model helps organizations to link improvements to its goals

Options.Name: Organizations should work through the steps of the model in the sequence in which they are presented
The flow of the model helps organizations to link improvements to its goals
The model is applicable to only certain parts of the service value system
Organizations should use an additional model or method to link improvements to customer value

questions.Name: What is the definition of warranty?
questions.explaination: Correct: A means of determining whether a service is fit for use

Options.Name: A means of identifying events that could cause harm or loss
A means of determining whether a service is fit for purpose
A means of identifying a result for a stakeholder
A means of determining whether a service is fit for use

questions.Name: Which practice has a purpose that includes managing risks relating to confidentiality, integrity and availability?
questions.explaination: Correct: Information security management

questions.Name: Which ITIL practice has the purpose to establish and nurture the links between the organization and its stakeholders at strategic and tactical levels?
questions.explaination: Correct: Relationship management

questions.Name: Which statement about the use of measurement in the 'start where you are' guiding principle is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: It should always be used to support direct observation

Options.Name: It should always be used to support direct observation
It should always be used instead of direct observation
Measured data is always more accurate than direct observation
The act of measuring always positively impacts results

questions.Name: Which statement about value creating activities is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: Each value stream should be designed with a specific combination of service value chain activities

Options.Name: Each value stream should be designed with a specific combination of service value chain activities
Service value chain activities have pre-determined dependencies on ITIL practices
A value stream is an operating model for creating value through products and services
Organizations should ensure that each value stream is applicable to many scenarios

questions.Name: Which is provided by the 'engage' value chain activity?
questions.explaination: Correct: Ensuring that stakeholder needs are understood by the organization

Options.Name: Ensuring that stakeholder expectations for quality are met
Ensuring that stakeholder needs are understood by the organization
Ensuring that service components are available when needed
Ensuring that services are operated to meet agreed specifications

questions.Name: Which is part of the 'focus on value' guiding principle?
questions.explaination: Correct: Understanding what services help the service consumer

Options.Name: Understanding what services help the service consumer
Reducing the number of steps in the customer experience
Assessing services to identify parts that can be reused
Identifying activities that can be achieved in smaller iterations

questions.Name:
Identify the missing word in the following sentence. 
A service is a means of enabling value co-creation by facilitating [?] that customers want to achieve, without the customer having to manage specific costs and risks.
questions.explaination: Correct: outcomes

questions.Name: Which guiding principle helps an organization to understand the impact of an altered element on other elements in a system?
questions.explaination: Correct: Think and work holistically

questions.Name:
Identify the missing words in the following sentence. 
The 'incident management' practice should maintain [?] for logging and managing incidents.
questions.explaination: Correct: a formal process

questions.Name: An organization asks a stakeholder to review a planned change. Which guiding principle does this demonstrate?
questions.explaination: Correct: Collaborate and promote visibility

questions.Name: What is the purpose of the 'deployment management' practice?
questions.explaination: Correct: To move new or changed components to live environments

Options.Name: To make new and changed services and features available for use
To move new or changed components to live environments
To plan and manage the full lifecycle of all IT assets
To protect the information needed by the organization to conduct its business

questions.Name:
Which TWO statements about the guiding principles are CORRECT?
  1. The guiding principles support continual improvement
  2. Each guiding principle applies to a selection of the available stakeholder groups
  3. Organizations should decide which one of the guiding principles is relevant to them
  4. Organizations should consider how the guiding principles interact with each other
questions.explaination: Correct: 1 and 4

questions.Name: Which statement about change authorities is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: Change authorities are assigned for each type of change and change model

Options.Name: Change authorities are only required for authorizing emergency changes
Change authorities are assigned when each change is deployed
Change authorities are only required for authorizing normal changes
Change authorities are assigned for each type of change and change model

questions.Name: Which is an activity of the 'problem management' practice?
questions.explaination: Correct: Prioritization of problems based on the risk that they pose

Options.Name: Restoration of normal service operation as quickly as possible
Prioritization of problems based on the risk that they pose
Authorization of changes to resolve the cause of problems
Resolution of incidents in a time that meets customer expectations

questions.Name: Which is an activity of 'problem identification'?
questions.explaination: Correct: Analysing information from software developers

questions.Name: Which practice uses technologies such as intelligent telephony systems, a knowledge base and monitoring tools?
questions.explaination: Correct: Service desk

questions.Name: Which statement about standard changes is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: The change does not require additional authorization

Options.Name: A full assessment should be completed each time the change is implemented
The change can be implemented with less testing if necessary
The appropriate change authority should be assigned to each type of change
The change does not require additional authorization

questions.Name:
Which TWO are considered part of the 'organizations and people' dimension of service management?
  1. Systems of authority
  2. Culture
  3. Relationships between organizations
  4. Workflows
questions.explaination: Correct: 1 and 2

questions.Name: Which statement about service requests is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: Service requests are usually formalized using standard procedures for initiation, approval and fulfilment

Options.Name: Complex service requests should be dealt with as normal changes
Service requests that require simple workflows should be dealt with as incidents
Service requests require workflows that should use manual procedures and avoid automation
Service requests are usually formalized using standard procedures for initiation, approval and fulfilment

questions.Name: What is an incident?
questions.explaination: Correct: A service interruption resolved by the use of self-help tools

Options.Name: The planned removal of an item that might affect a service
A result enabled by one or more outputs
A possible future event that could cause harm
A service interruption resolved by the use of self-help tools

questions.Name: Which statement about the 'service request management' practice is CORRECT?
questions.explaination: Correct: Financial authorization is sometimes required for service requests

Options.Name: Service requests are fulfilled using simple workflows
A new workflow is created for each type of request
Additional approval is sometimes needed for restoration of service
Financial authorization is sometimes required for service requests

questions.Name: What is a cause, or potential cause, of one or more incidents?
questions.explaination: Correct: A problem
